intro: Codonopsis chimiliensis, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Codonopsis chimiliensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
